alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 7:56AM EDT until August 06 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Jackson. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 756 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McKee, Hurley, Bradshaw, Shop Branch, Atkinstown, Macedonia, Dabolt, Gray Hawk, Waneta, Olin, Deese, Foxtown, Mildred, Annville, Turkey Foot, Bond, Cornelius, Collingsworth, Privett and Settle Store.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
